ai:cl.c: Manages the scene graph for a collection of vectors.

ai:a.c: Renders the scene to a bitmap.
ai:a.p: ERR acDraw(*Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Width, DOUBLE Height)

ai:i.c: The X position of the region to be drawn.
The Y position of the region to be drawn.
The width of the region to be drawn.
The height of the region to be drawn.

ai:a.c: Flush buffered data from an object.
Redefines the size of the page.
ai:a.p: ERR acRedimension(*Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Z, DOUBLE Width, DOUBLE Height, DOUBLE Depth)

ai:i.c: The new X position to apply to the target object.
The new Y position to apply to the target object.
The new Z position to apply to the target object.
The new width of the target object.
The new height of the target object.
The new depth of the target object.

ai:a.c: Clears all registered definitions and resets field values. Child vectors are unmodified.
Redefines the size of the page.
ai:a.p: ERR acResize(*Object, DOUBLE Width, DOUBLE Height, DOUBLE Depth)

ai:i.c: The new width of the object.
The new height of the object.
The new depth of the object.

ai:m.c: Registers a named definition object within a scene graph.
ai:m.p: ERR sc::AddDef(OBJECTPTR Object, CSTRING Name, OBJECTPTR Def)

ai:i.c: The unique name to associate with the definition.

ai:m.c: Search for a vector definition by name.
ai:m.p: ERR sc::FindDef(OBJECTPTR Object, CSTRING Name, OBJECTPTR * Def)

ai:i.c: A pointer to the definition object is returned here if discovered.

ai:m.c: Search for a vector by numeric ID.
ai:m.p: ERR sc::SearchByID(OBJECTPTR Object, INT ID, OBJECTPTR * Result)

ai:i.c: This parameter will be updated with the discovered vector, or NULL if not found.

ai:f.c: Refers to a top-level VectorScene object, if applicable.
The height of the page that contains the vector.
The width of the page that contains the vector.
Returns the rendering time of the last scene.
The sampling method to use when interpolating images and patterns.
May refer to a Surface object for enabling automatic rendering.
References the first object in the scene, which must be a VectorViewport object.
